image.altText: A woman's hands hold a human skull.

props.synopsis: SA Police says it had "expertly assessed" several skeletal remains listed for sale by the auction house and the "sale of these anatomically prepared human remains" was not in breach of any state laws.

title.children: Auction house did not break law by selling human bones, police say

image.altText: legs of a young person in jeans in a dark stairwell.

props.synopsis: The SA opposition says the state is in the grip of a "youth crime crisis", and while the state's police chief has denied the situation is "worse than it has ever been", the government has ruled out raising the age of criminal responsibility.Â

title.children: Is SA facing a 'youth crime crisis', and how should it manage young offenders?

image.altText: Beaumont children photo

props.synopsis: A seven-day search for the Beaumont children, who went missing from Glenelg Beach in 1966, has concluded after "almost 10,000 tonnes" of soil was dug up as part of the "biggest clandestine grave dig in the world".

title.children: 'We can walk away satisfied': Search for Beaumont children concludes

image.altText: Henry Thornton of South Australia celebrates, raising his arms and extending his index fingers

props.synopsis: South Australia's triumphant cricketers are setting their sights on a historic double, after winning the one-day competition for the first time in 13 years.

title.children: South Australia end 13-year drought with One Day Cup triumph

image.altText: A man with grey hair and a grey goatee smiling while leaning back in a lounge chair.

props.synopsis: An experienced South Australian snake catcher has spent a week in hospital after being bitten by a lice-infested snake he was treating with a bath.

title.children: One lousy bath leaves snake catcher in hot water

image.altText: Rhoda Roberts holding on to a boxing bag.

props.synopsis: A new stage show at this year's Adelaide Festival shines a light on the struggles that one of Australia's first Indigenous Olympians faced both in and out of the boxing ring, and on his battle for securing recognition and respect inside his own country. Warning: This story contains the image and name of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: He was a trailblazer in the ring, now his battle is being celebrated on stage

image.altText: Shiraz grapes on the vine at the Kalleske winery in South Australia.

props.synopsis: Farmers in Australia's largest wine grape regions are calling on the federal government to implement a mandatory code of conduct immediately to stop a mass exodus of growers.

title.children: Wine grape growers demand safeguards for industry in 'crisis'

image.altText: Close up image of lamb and other meat in a cabinet at a butcher

props.synopsis: While many meat eaters have opted for local butchers over supermarkets in recent years, some butchers say they are finding it tough to find and retain qualified staff and apprentices.Â

title.children: Local butchers bounce back, but staffing is a challenge

image.altText: Close up of phone with someone about to place a bet on a sports game

props.synopsis: About $32 billion a year is now lost by people betting online, mostly by those who can't afford it. A bill that would force online betting outfits to display to each client what they're losing, and what they've lost, each time they log on is hoped to change that.

title.children: We lose $32b a year to online gambling. A new bill might help reduce it

image.altText: Beaches closed

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Alfred is forecast to make landfall as a category two system from Thursday, but the weather bureau says it is unclear where it will cross the coast.Â

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Alfred forecast to make landfall from Thursday

image.altText: Vincent Fantauzzo

props.synopsis: How the famous portrait of the Hollywood actor forged an enduring bond between his grieving father and the artist, Vincent Fantauzzo.

title.children: How Heath Ledger's death changed Vincent Fantauzzo's life

image.altText: A building at Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: The SA government had been pursuing GFG Alliance over unpaid royalties since the beginning of last year â and made repeated threats to suspend the company's mining permits, according to documents obtained under Freedom of Information.

title.children: SA government had been chasing GFG Alliance over debts since early 2024

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton stand next to each other.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton send clear signals that we stand as a nation with Ukraine but they are not dealing with the deeper reality that our once reliable American partner is no longer reliable in the same way.

title.children: Albanese and Dutton aren't facing reality â our US alliance is in crisis

image.altText: A sign on the closed metal bar gates says: "Close NANA backpackers hostel until problem is resolved and new orders."

props.synopsis: Months after the deaths of Holly Bowles and Bianca Jones, their families say they are furious at the lack of information from Lao authorities and want travellers to boycott the country until a proper investigation is held.

title.children: Parents of methanol poisoning victims left with silence, not answers

image.altText: A Qantas plane taxies along a runway in overcast conditions while passengers seated inside watch on.

props.synopsis: Pacific Islanders spending large amounts of money trying to secure Australia's new permanent residency visa say the experience has left them dejected and anxious.

title.children: Applicants report delays after 'investing everything' in Australian visa

image.altText: An outdoor shopping strip.

props.synopsis: The ABC spoke to a number of people living in St Albans, in Melbourne's west, on issues that they see as key ahead of the federal election.Â

title.children: In Melbourne's west, cost-of-living pressures could sway key contests

image.altText: pope francis sits in wheelchair and waves

props.synopsis: The 88-year-old pontiff has been in hospital since mid-February, and last week suffered an "isolated" breathing crisis.

title.children: Pope says he feels 'carried' by well-wishers in written message

image.altText: A close up view of a smoke stack at the Whyalla steelworks, taken at sunset

props.synopsis: Some business and climate groups have voiced their support for keeping one of the federal government's key climate policies in place, with the Coalition yet to commit to its future.

title.children: Australia's key climate policy faces an uncertain future

image.altText: A photo of Emmanuel College in Warrnambool, with several students sitting on the lawn

props.synopsis: A former teacher takes a Victorian Catholic school to the Fair Work Commission, alleging she was fired after raising concerns about bullying within staff.

title.children: Private school teacher allegedly sacked after flagging staff bullying

image.altText: A composite image of three men in suits

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump up-ends world order during his first few weeks in power, Xi Jinping is quietly testing the boundaries of this new reality, and the fallout could be felt in Ukraine, Taiwan and Australia.Â

title.children: As Trump radically shifts the global order, Xi tests new boundaries

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A space craft hovers above the Moon

props.synopsis: A private lunar lander carrying equipment for NASA touches down on the Moon, the latest in a string of companies looking to kickstart business on Earth's celestial neighbour ahead of astronaut missions.

title.children: Private lunar lander Blue Ghost touches down on Moon

image.altText: Peter and Kirilly Dutton walk in a Lunar New Year parade in melbourne

props.synopsis: Of the 20 electorates considered in play this election, at least half of them have a Chinese-Australian population that is well above the national average

title.children: 'Pro-China' Dutton seeking to woo back crucial voters

image.altText: A white and red passenger ship moored in a bay in an industrial area.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has instructed state-owned ferry operator TT-Line to stop lease negotiations for the Spirit of Tasmania IV and bring it home. The new vessel has been berthed in Scotland while the state government investigated leasing options.

title.children: Lease negotiations for new Spirit of Tasmania ditched, ferry to come home

image.altText: Jane Hume Katy Gallagher

props.synopsis: Frank and fearless advice about how Australia should navigate Trump's tariffs was lost in the din of election season.

title.children: Treasury came armed with a warning. Politicians dragged them into the mud

image.altText: Ryan Peake pumps his fists after winning NZ Open.

props.synopsis: Eleven years after being handed a prison sentence, former Rebels bikie gang member Ryan Peake completes a dramatic victory at the New Zealand Open.

title.children: Ex-Rebels bikie Peake wins New Zealand Open by one stroke

image.altText: Our AI future

props.synopsis: The future rarely unfolds like we expect. Although Hollywood has given us plenty of technological tropes to worry about, our AI future is much more mundane and much more insidious.

title.children: Our AI future isn't conscious robots with lethal ambition. It might be worse

image.altText: Vasyl Myroshnychenko, dressed in green, speaks in front of a picture

props.synopsis: Ambassador Vasyl Myroshnychenko calls the Oval Office showdown between US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy a "big shock".

title.children: Ukraine 'cannot survive' without ongoing US support, ambassador says

image.altText: A military helicopter lands in bushland, kicking up clouds of dust.

props.synopsis: An experienced army pilot has told an inquiry into the Taipan helicopter crash, which claimed the lives of four airmen, he would have considered not completing the mission had it been in similar conditions.

title.children: Fatal army mission 'failed as soon as they took off', Taipan inquiry hears

image.altText: Rower rescue

props.synopsis: A search and rescue operation is underway for a Lithuanian man attempting to row from San Diego to Brisbane caught up in Cyclone Alfred off the Queensland coast.

title.children: Emergency alert triggers search for Lithuanian rower off Queensland coast

image.altText: David Johansen poses for a portrait with long hair and trimmed goatee beard

props.synopsis: David Johansen, the wiry, gravel-voiced singer and last surviving member of the glam and proto-punk band the New York Dolls, has died at the age of 75.

title.children: New York Dolls singer David Johansen dies aged 75

image.altText: Household money pic

props.synopsis: There are several factors behind why Labor hasn't gone on a celebratory tour to boast about having "pulled off" something that's never been achieved in Australia.

title.children: Why isn't the Albanese government boasting about falling inflation?

image.altText: A woman sits at a desk and looks into the camera. Her reflection can be seen on a computer screen.

props.synopsis: The ABC looked at how home insurance premiums compared for different age groups around the country â the results were surprising.

title.children: $17,000 dropped from home insurance premium when owner queried the cost

image.altText: A man crouching down on a riverbank inspecting a bit of rock

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal elder says it is disgraceful an ancient cultural site on the Murray River was damaged during the summer holiday period.Â

title.children: Elder blasts 'disgraceful' damage to riverside midden site
